page.title: Me and My Shadows: A Family Memoir

revision.comment: Adding image
revision.text:
{{infobox book | name = Me and My Shadows: A Family Memoir | title_orig = | image = Me and My Shadows A Family Memoir.jpg| author = [[Lorna Luft]] | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | genre = [[Autobiography]] | publisher = [[Simon & Schuster]] | release_date = April 24, 1998 | media_type = Print ([[Hardcover]]) | pages = 432 | isbn = 978-0-6710190-0-6 | dewey = 782.42/164/092/2 | congress = 98-190061 | oclc = 44273369 }} '''''Me and My Shadows: A Family Memoir''''' is a 1998 [[memoir]] written by [[Lorna Luft]], the daughter of singer-actress [[Judy Garland]].
==Overview== The book, which recounts her mother's life, Luft's life with Garland and dealing with life after her mother's death, was a [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''New York Times'' best seller]] and published by [[Simon & Schuster]].
==Adaptation== The book was adapted into an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award-winning]] [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] [[miniseries]], ''[[Life with Judy Garland: Me and My Shadows]]'', which aired February 25 and 26, 2001 and later released on [[DVD]]. It starred [[Tammy Blanchard]] as the teenage Judy and [[Judy Davis]] as the adult Judy.
==External links== *[http://books.simonandschuster.com/Me-and-My-Shadows/Lorna-Luft/9780671019006/retailers ''Me and My Shadows: A Family Memoir''] at [[Simon & Schuster]] *[https://www.nytimes.com/tv/show/53379/Life-With-Judy-Garland-Me-and-My-Shadows/overview ''New York Times'' article]
[[Category:1998 books]] [[Category:American biographies]] [[Category:American memoirs]] [[Category:Books adapted into films]] [[Category:Show business memoirs]] [[Category:Judy Garland]]

revision.comment: Caption
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{short lead|date=October 2017}} {{plot|date=October 2016}}}} {{Infobox film | name = Phantasm: Ravager | image = Phantasm Ravager (2016 Film).jpg | caption = Film poster | director = David Hartman | producer = [[Don Coscarelli]] | writer = {{plainlist| * David Hartman * Don Coscarelli }} | based on = {{based on|Characters|Don Coscarelli}} | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Reggie Bannister]] * [[A. Michael Baldwin]] * Bill Thornbury * Kathy Lester * [[Gloria Lynne Henry]] * Dawn Cody * Stephen Jutras * [[Daniel Roebuck]] * Daniel Schweiger * [[Angus Scrimm]] }} | music = Christopher L. Stone | cinematography = David Hartman
Brad Baruh | editing = David Hartman
Jhoanne Reyes
Michael Miles | distributor = Well Go Entertainment | released = {{film date|2016|09|25|Austin's Fantastic Fest|2016|10|04|Video on Demand|2016|10|07|US}} | runtime = 85 minutes | country = United States | language = English }} '''''Phantasm: Ravager''''' (sometimes styalized as '''''Phantasm: RaVager''''' and also known as '''''Phantasm V''''') is a 2016 American [[horror film]], and the fifth and final installment in the [[Phantasm (film series)|''Phantasm'' series]]. It marks the only film in the series not directed by [[Don Coscarelli]], although he acts as producer and co-writer. It is directed by David Hartman and stars [[A. Michael Baldwin]], [[Reggie Bannister]], and [[Angus Scrimm]] in his final appearance as the [[Tall Man (Phantasm)|Tall Man]]. ==Plot== The film begins with Reggie, running about in the desert, still on the trail of his nemesis - the [[Tall Man (Phantasm)|Tall Man]]. He then pays a man to offer him a ride, but realizes it's actually his car they're in, and the man stole it when he recalls putting a gun in the middle compartment. He chucks the man out, but two spheres suddenly fly by, and one sphere kills the man on the road while the other chases after Reggie. He manages to defeat them however, but then wakes up in a hospital sitting with Mike talking to him as he sits in a wheelchair, who apparently looks after him due to him having an early stage of [[dementia]]. He then tells Mike his story. In an apparent dream setting, Reggie meets a woman who mistakes him for a friend. Her car isn't working, so Reggie offers her a lift. They go to a cabin on a farm, and Reggie learns that a Bulgarian man named Demeter helps out. Reggie explains to her about his dealings with The Tall Man over the years, and she is amazed by his tale. He tries his usual lady wooing, but is turned down. As he plays a song, he cannot remember her name, and goes to sleep. Later, The Tall Man shows up with more of his deadly spheres. A flashback scene then shows Reggie in the hospital, but it is the hospital from the 1860s. The Tall Man (or his original identity, Jebediah) is lying in the bed next to him. They then talk. Jebediah explains he's nearly finished, and has lost many friends. He says they are both there basically to die. Reggie wakes up the next morning, remembering the lady's name is Dawn. He gets no answer when he asks her a question, and finds that she's been killed by spheres, that then give chase. Reggie equips himself with a shotgun. The spheres force him into a nearby barn. A man armed with an axe confronts him, and it's revealed he is Demeter. A sphere kills a horse. Another sphere then manages to get inside the barn, killing Demeter, before Reggie fights it off. Reggie speaks to Mike again in the hospital. Mike tells him about a new threat looming. Back in his dream, Reggie goes through the woods. Along a path, he encounters a gigantic sphere hovering in the sky, and Reggie is back at the hospital again. Reggie alternates between the other world in both his dream, and the present time. The Tall Man appears, and says their paths cross again. It's 1979; a younger self will attend a funeral in Morningside, and that all his efforts got him nowhere. The Tall Man proclaims he can resurrect Reggie's dead family in exchange for him ceasing his meddling. Reggie is next seen in a mortuary, contending with the dwarf "Lurker" followers of The Tall Man, and the Lady in Lavender appears. She is shot by Reggie and seemingly killed. Continuing on, Reggie goes into a large cave, shooting a dwarf and the place shakes. The Tall Man asks him if he's considered his offer, but when Reggie retaliates, The Tall Man again reminds him his chances are depleting. Reggie wants his friends Jodie and Mike back, but The Tall Man recognizes his "loyalty" for his friends as foolishness. In yet another dream sequence which he alternates with the nightmare world, Reggie is strapped to a gurney as armed masked people appear. One is called Chunk and the other is revealed to be the person Reggie knew as Dawn despite her death, but she says her name is actually Jane and she thinks Reggie is delusional. She radios in some people. Reggie fails to convince her they know each other, but she gets him medical attention instead. More evil dwarf things show up to attack Reggie, but Chunk saves him and gives him a weapon. Dawn & Chunk take Reggie to other members of their group who are fighting the Tall Man. Mike reunites with Reggie, and then escape the nightmare hospital. Mike tells Reggie he's been out of action for a decade in a coma, and the Earth has changed. He says it's no longer their home, it's The Tall Man's now. In the dream world, Reggie wanders around the hospital hallways, but a nurse orders him back to his room. In the nightmare world, an enemy has grabbed him. A spiked sphere then kills one of the people helping Reggie. Mike visits Reggie at the hospital, and says his dream orientates him. Mike reveals he had a dream too where he was in the desert, looking for Reggie. It turns out Mike still has his connection to The Tall Man. Mike reveals The Tall Man unleashed an alien virus that caused an apocalypse on society worldwide. Jane is caught by The Tall Man, so Chunk, Mike and Reggie go after The Tall Man. In his own red planet world, they face and battle The Tall Man, Jane is killed. Chunk, who posed as a dwarf next to the Tall Man, then turns the tables. Chunk blows himself up to try to kill The Tall Man. Back at the hospital, Reggie fights some Gravers alongside Mike. Jodie shows up in a car spewing bullets to save them. After driving awhile, they decide to drive north as The Tall Man hates the cold. In a flashback to the hospital, however, Reggie seemingly passes away in bed while Mike & Jody are holding his hands, and the film ends. During the end-credits, Chunk appears through a portal along a desert road, missing a hand, and meets up with Rocky. Chunk flirts with her, asking Rocky if he has a chance. Rocky teases back saying that there are no other guys around, but Rocky then sees Reggie and the others pulling up in the Barricuda heading north, and they get in. Lots of giant spheres are then shown in the sky in the distance, indicating the war with The Tall Man is far from over. ==Cast== * [[Angus Scrimm]] as [[Tall Man (Phantasm)|The Tall Man]] * [[A. Michael Baldwin]] as Mike Pearson * [[Reggie Bannister]] as [[Reggie (Phantasm)|Reggie]] * Dawn Cody as Dawn / Jane * Stephen Jutras as Chunk * Bill Thornbury as Jody Pearson * Kathy Lester as Lady in Lavender * [[Gloria Lynne Henry]] as Rocky * [[Daniel Roebuck]] as Demeter * Solly Duran as Raina * Daniel Schweiger as Thief ==Production== In 2004, six years after the release of ''[[Phantasm IV: Oblivion]]'', series director Don Coscarelli told ''[[Fangoria]]'', "I’d also still like to do another ''Phantasm'' film. Reggie Bannister and Angus Scrimm are still in great shape and raring to go."{{cite web|url=http://fangoria.com/news_article.php?id=2323|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040603043907/http://fangoria.com/news_article.php?id=2323 |title=Don Coscarelli talks BUBBA sequel possibilities |work=fangoria.com |date=2004-05-11 |archivedate=2004-06-03 |accessdate=2014-03-28}} In March 2005, it was announced that Coscarelli was in the final stages of talks with [[New Line Cinema]] to produce a new entry. According to ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', the new film was "being developed as a relaunch and as a possible trilogy about Mike's coming of age."{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000835831|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060109120415/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/film/brief_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000835831 |title='Phantasm' in New Line's airspace |work=hollywoodreporter.com |date=2005-03-10 |archivedate=2006-01-09 |accessdate=2014-03-28}} This version never came to fruition. Rumors about a sequel were reignited in June 2007 by footage contained in Don Coscarelli's ''Farewell to the Alamo Drafthouse'', featuring Angus Scrimm and A. Michael Baldwin in their roles. However an interview with Reggie Bannister surfaced on YouTube, and, when asked about the possibility of a fifth film, he stated there was no activity or development but that anything was possible in the future.{{cite web|url=http://www.phantasm.com/secrets/?p=33 |title=Blog » Blog Archive » Don Coscarelli's Farewell To The Alamo Drafthouse |work=Phantasm.com |date=2007-07-01 |accessdate=2013-10-25}} In June 2012, rumors again surfaced that Coscarelli would begin a new ''Phantasm'' sequel. According to a report on [[Dread Central]], a reliable source told them the script was completed and filming would begin later in the year.{{cite web|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3146849/is-don-coscarelli-finally-gearing-up-for-phantasm-5/|title=UPDATED: Is Don Coscarelli Finally Gearing Up For 'Phantasm 5'? Nope! |work=bloody-disgusting.com|accessdate=2014-03-28|date=2012-06-06}} Coscarelli disputed this claim, publicly stating, "I have no solid news to report on a new project now." The director, however, was being coy with film news sites. According to what Coscarelli and new co-writer-director David Hartman told ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', the film was shot secretly{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/03/video-phantasm-5-ravager-trailer/ |title=Hot Teaser Trailer: 'Phantasm V: Ravager' |work=deadline.com |date=2014-03-26 |accessdate=2014-03-28}} in and around southern California during 2012 and 2013.{{cite web|url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2014/03/27/phantasm-5-ravager-trailer-exclusive/ |title='Phantasm: Ravager' cast details and teaser trailer -- EXCLUSIVE VIDEO |work=ew.com |date=2014-03-27 |accessdate=2014-03-28}} On March 26, 2014, news of ''Ravager''{{'}}s completion was released via various film news sites. The next day, a teaser trailer debuted on the film's official site.{{cite web|url=http://www.phantasm.com/ |title=Phantasm V: Ravager |work=Phantasm.com |date=2014-03-26 |accessdate=2014-03-28}} In a 2014 "sneak peek" video preview on the official Phantasm website, director Hartman mentioned in quick passing, "This thing is going to be in the can 2015... for sure."{{cite web|url=http://phantasm.com/secrets/ |title=Phantasm V: Ravager |work=Phantasm.com |date=2014-03-26 |accessdate=2015-02-06}} In September 2015 at Scarefest in Lexington, Kentucky, it was announced that the film has been delayed until 2016. The next month, Reggie Bannister announced that ''Ravager'' is completed and is awaiting a distributor.{{cite web|url=http://phantasmarchives.blogspot.com/2015/09/phantasm-ravager-delayed-to-2106.html |title=Phantasm Ravager Delayed to 2016 |work=phantasmarchives.blogspot.com |date=2015-09-13 |accessdate=2015-09-15}}{{cite web|url=http://phantasmarchives.blogspot.com/2015/10/news-phantasm-ravager-is-finished.html |title=News: Phantasm Ravager is Finished |work=phantasmarchives.blogspot.com |accessdate=2015-10-02}} Production on the film was briefly halted when Coscarelli supervised a 4K restoration of the original ''Phantasm''.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/12/14/phantasm-jj-abrams-star-wars|title=Phantasm director talks J.J. Abrams' 4K restoration: 'The Tall Man's balls are a lot more shiny'|last=Collis|first=Clark|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=2015-12-14|accessdate=2015-12-26}} On January 9, 2016, actor [[Angus Scrimm]], who played The Tall Man, died at age 89.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/01/10/angus-scrimm-obituary-phantasm|title=Phantasm star Angus Scrimm dies at 89|last=Collis|first=Clark|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=2016-01-10|accessdate=2016-01-10}} ==Release== ''Phantasm V: Ravager'' premiered in [[Austin]]'s [[Fantastic Fest]] on September 25, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://phantasm.com/|title=Phantasm Ravager World Premiere in Austin Sept 25th!|publisher=phantasm.com|accessdate=2011-08-04|language=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/08/02/fantastic-fest-lineup-2016|title=Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children and Phantasm: Ravager to screen at this year's Fantastic Fest|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=2011-08-04}} It was released in the United States in theaters and via digital HD on October 7, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/07/28/phantasm-remastered-ravager-don-coscarelli?xid=entertainment-weekly_socialflow_twitter|title=Phantasm: Remastered and Phantasm: Ravager flying into cinemas this fall|publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=2011-07-28}} The film and its predecessors are expected to be digitally remastered for home media soon thereafter. ==Reception== [[Rotten Tomatoes]], a [[review aggregator]], reports that 54% of 13 surveyed critics gave the film a positive review; the average rating is 5.1/10.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/phantasm_ravager/|title=Phantasm: Ravager|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=2016-10-09}} [[Metacritic]], another review aggregator, rated it 51/100 based on seven reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/phantasm-ravager|title=Phantasm: Ravager|work=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=2016-10-09}} [[Joe Leydon]] of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' and Marten Carlson of ''[[Consequence of Sound]]'' both criticized the film's narrative cohesiveness.{{cite web|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2016/09/film-review-phantasm-ravager/|title=Film Review: ''Phantasm: Ravager''|last=Carlson|first=Marten|work=[[Consequence of Sound]]|date=2016-09-26|accessdate=2016-09-30}}{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/reviews/phantasm-ravager-review-1201873751/|title=Film Review: ''Phantasm: Ravager''|last=Leydon|first=Joe|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=2016-09-29|accessdate=2016-09-30}} Leydon speculated that the film's troubled production may have cause this, and Carlson more directly blamed the film's origin as a series of shorts. Both said this will probably cause outsiders to be confused by the film. In comparing it to the previous films, Carlson said it "captures the heart, if not the quality", though fans will likely forgive its faults, as they did the first film. Leydon, though describing it as "a patchwork quilt of outtakes from its four predecessors", also cited the appeal to fans to revisit their favorite characters. Though recognizing the film's narrative weakness, Michele Galgana of ''[[Screen Anarchy]]'' wrote, "Still, it's impossible to overlook the fun that you see all these guys having, and their hearts are all in the right place."{{cite web|url=http://screenanarchy.com/2016/09/fantastic-fest-2016-review-phantasm-ravager.html|title=Fantastic Fest 2016 Review: ''Phantasm Ravager''|last=Galgana|first=Michele|work=[[Screen Anarchy]]|date=2016-09-30|accessdate=2016-09-30}} Simon Abrams of ''[[Roger Ebert|Roger Ebert.com]]'' gave the film two and a half stars saying the "CGI-intensive action scenes are distractingly ugly-looking. The camerawork is also amateurish, and the film's drab, undistinguished dialogue is only interesting when it's explicitly calling back to the original ''Phantasm.''"{{cite web|last=Abrams|first=Simon|title=Phantasm: Ravager|url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/phantasm-ravager-2016|publisher=[[Roger Ebert|Roger Ebert.com]]|date=October 7, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2017}} Marten Carlson of ''[[Consequence of Sound]]'' criticized the look of the film saying "at its best, though, the film’s cheap production is impossible to ignore. The cinematography is flat and appears to have been shot on a consumer HD camera. The special effects are achieved primarily with low-grade CGI that’s laughable at times."{{cite web|last=Carlson|first=Marten|title=Film Review: Phantasm: Ravager|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2016/09/film-review-phantasm-ravager/|publisher=[[Consequence of Sound]]|date=September 26, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2017}} Carlson ultimately said "All formal complaints aside, Ravager is successful in its attempt to capture the spirit of the series. Phantasm has always been about family, the love between brothers and friends, and seeing Reggie and Mike together again, we can only feel the sincerity of their relationship." Reviewers at ''Bloody Disgusting'' were split with Trace Thurman placing it on his "5 Worst Horror Movies of 2016"{{cite web|last=Thurman|first=Trace|title=5 Worst Horror Movies of 2016|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/editorials/3417512/traces-worst-horror-movies-2016/2/|publisher=[[Bloody Disgusting]]|date=December 29, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2017}} yet John Squires loved it.{{cite web|last=Squires|first=John|title=Why I Love ‘Phantasm: Ravager’: 2016’s Most Charming Horror Film|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3419577/love-phantasm-ravager-2016s-charming-horror-film/|publisher=[[Bloody Disgusting]]|date=December 29, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2017}} However, both agreed the film looked like a "cheaply-made student film." ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} * {{official website|http://www.phantasm.com}} * {{IMDb title|3627704}} * [https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/phantasm_ravager Phantasm Ravager at Rotten Tomatoes] {{Phantasm}} [[Category:2016 films]] [[Category:2016 horror films]] [[Category:2010s science fiction films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American science fiction horror films]] [[Category:American independent films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Funeral homes in fiction]] [[Category:American supernatural horror films]] [[Category:Sequel films]] [[Category:Action horror films]]

revision.comment: [[:Template:Nursery rhymes]] closed as delete per [[Wikipedia:Templates for discussion/Log/2018 September 11#Template:Nursery rhymes]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox song | Name = Poor Mary | Published = 1880s | Type = [[Nursery rhyme]] }} '''"Poor Mary"''' or '''"Poor Jenny"''' is a popular [[English language]] [[nursery rhyme]] and [[singing game]]. It has a [[Roud Folk Song Index]] number of 1377.
==Lyrics== Lyrics vary considerably for this song. Over a hundred known variations have been collected in Britain since the 1880s, not least in the use of the names, including Jenny, Mary and Sally. Common modern versions include: :Poor Jenny is a-weeping, :A-weeping, a-weeping, :Poor Jenny is a-weeping :On a bright summer’s day.
:Why are you weeping, :Weeping, weeping, :Why are you weeping, :On a bright summer's day?
:I'm weeping for a loved one, :A loved one, a loved one, :I'm weeping for a loved one, :On a bright summer's day.
:Stand up and choose your loved one, :Your loved one, your loved one, :Stand up and choose your loved one, :One a bright summer's day.
:Shake hands before you leave 'er, :You leave 'er, you leave 'er, :Shake hands before you leave 'er, :On a bright summer's day.<ref name=Opie1985>[[I. Opie and P. Opie]], ''The Singing Game'' (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1985), pp. 325–9.</ref>
==The game== One child of the group is chosen to be "Jenny" or "Mary" etc., and has to kneel in the middle of a circle, usually with head in hands. The other children join their hands and walk around the other child singing the first verse. The child in the centre then carries out the actions of the following verses, most importantly choosing a partner.
==The tune== The tune is widely known in Europe, and forms the first section of the folk dance tune "La Bourrée des Galvachers" from Burgundy, France.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWQSOKd03zY</ref> The melody was also used by [[Dmitri Shostakovich]] in his [[Piano Concerto No. 1 (Shostakovich)|first Piano Concerto, op.35.]]<ref>Dmitri Shostakovich, ''Piano Concerto'' (London: Boosey & Hawkes, n.d. HPS644). Compare the trumpet solo in the nine bars starting one bar after rehearsal mark 63 with the melody as given by Opie; they are identical.</ref>
==See also== * [[Kagome Kagome]] {{Portal |Children's literature}}
==Notes== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Children's games]] [[Category:Singing games]] [[Category:Roud Folk Song Index songs]] [[Category:English nursery rhymes]]

/* Sex trafficking */ Tier 2 Watch List
revision.text:
'''Prostitution in Guinea-Bissau''' is common and there are no [[prostitution]] laws.<ref name="chartsbin">{{cite web|title=The Legal Status of Prostitution by Country|url=http://chartsbin.com/view/snb|website=ChartsBin|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> In 2016 it was estimated there were 3,138 prostitutes in the country.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sex workers: Population size estimate - Number, 2016 |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/dv/PivotData_2018_7_22_636678151733621264.htm |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> Often it is associated with other crimes: Many [[pimps]] are also reported to be [[drug dealers]]. Poverty leads many women to be tempted into prostitution and [[cocaine addiction]].<ref name="pulitzer">{{cite news|title=Guinea Bissau: Crack and prostitution, cocaine's other face |work=[[Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting|Pulitzer]]|date=30 June 2009|author=Marco Vernaschi|url= http://pulitzercenter.org/blog/untold-stories/guinea-bissau-crack-and-prostitution-cocaine%E2%80%99s-other-face|accessdate=2012-04-13}}</ref>
Many of the prostitutes in [[Bissau]] and other towns in Guinea-Bissau are Manjako women from [[Caio (Guinea-Bissau)|Caio]] in the [[Cacheu Region]].<ref name="buckner">{{cite web|last1=Buckner|first1=Margaret|title=Village women as town prostitutes: cultural factors relevant to prostitution and HIV epidemiology in Guinea-Bissau|url=https://www.codesria.org/IMG/pdf/22LBUCKNER_.pdf|website=Council for the Development of Social Science Research in Africa|accessdate=7 January 2018|date=1999}}</ref><ref name="ency">{{cite book|last1=Ditmore|first1=Melissa Hope (edited by)|title=Encyclopedia of prostitution and sex work|date=2006|publisher=Greenwood Press|location=Westport, Conn.|isbn=978-0313329685}}</ref> They tend to be over 30 and wait in designated rooms in their houses for clients. Occasionally they will go to a local bar in search of clients.<ref name="buckner" /> Prostitutes from Caio also travel to [[Ziguinchor]] in [[Senegal]] and [[Banjul]] in [[The Gambia]] to work.<ref name="ency" />
Younger prostitutes in the cities often work in bars.<ref name="pulitzer" />
There have been reports of [[child sex tourism]] on the [[Bissagos Islands]].<ref name="state16">{{cite web|title=Trafficking in Persons Report 2016 - Country Narratives - Guinea-Bissau|url=https://www.ecoi.net/local_link/326250/452829_en.html|publisher=US Department of State|accessdate=7 January 2018|language=en|date=30 June 2016}}{{PD-notice}}</ref>
==HIV== Like other countries in [[Sub-Saharan Africa]], [[HIV]] is a problem in the country.<ref>{{cite web|title=New cases of HIV / AIDS worry country's health authorities|url=https://uniogbis.unmissions.org/en/new-cases-hiv-aids-worry-countrys-health-authorities|website=UNIOGBIS|accessdate=7 January 2018|language=en|date=16 December 2016}}</ref> Adult prevalence is 3.1%<ref name="unaids">{{cite web|title=Guinea-Bissau 2016 Country factsheet|url=http://www.unaids.org/en/regionscountries/countries/guinea-bissau|website=[[UNAIDS]]|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
[[Condom]] use amongst sex workers is irregular,<ref name="pulitzer" /> which has led to an HIV prevalence amongst sex workers of 39%.<ref>{{cite web |title=HIV prevalence amongst sex workers |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/vc/vcshare.html?id=d9c0ff12-f62c-44e7-8e2c-dbe736bbea30 |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=22 July 2018 |date=2016}}</ref>
==Child prostitution== [[Child prostitution]] is a problem in the country. Many children engage in prostitution for survival. The activity mainly takes place in clubs, bars and hotels. The government takes little action, relying on [[NGO]]s to try and address the problem.<ref>{{cite web|title=Child Prostitution - Guinea-Bissau|url=http://gvnet.com/childprostitution/Guinea-Bissau.htm|website=GVNET|accessdate=7 January 2018}} maily culled from 10-15 year old sources, not verified.</ref>
Around 2000-2004 there have been reports of [[child sex tourism]] on the [[Bissagos Islands]].<ref name="state16" />
==Sex trafficking== {{see also|Human trafficking in Guinea-Bissau}} Guinea-Bissau is a source country for children subjected to [[sex trafficking]]. The extent to which adults are subjected to forced prostitution is unclear. Bissau-Guinean girls are subjected to child sex trafficking in [[Guinea]] and [[Senegal]].<ref name="state16" />
The [[United States Department of State]] [[Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons]] ranks Guinea-Bissau as a [[Trafficking in Persons Report#Ranking System|Tier 2 Watch List]] country.<ref name="state18">{{cite web |title=Guinea-Bissau 2018 Trafficking in Persons Report |url=https://www.state.gov/j/tip/rls/tiprpt/countries/2018/282665.htm |website=U.S. Department of State |accessdate=29 July 2018}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{Africa in topic|Prostitution in}}
