{{Infobox stage production|company=South Asian Sisters|premiere=2003|location=San Francisco Bay Area}}{{italic title}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2016}} '''''Yoni Ki Baat''''' (roughly translated from [[Hindi]] as "Talks of the Vagina," and sometimes abbreviated '''''YKB''''') is a project featuring the live performance of monologues by women of [[South Asian diaspora|South Asian origin]],{{cite web|url=http://southasiansisters.org/|title=South Asian Sisters|author=|date=|work=southasiansisters.org|accessdate=March 6, 2016}} loosely inspired by [[Eve Ensler|Eve Ensler's]] ''[[The Vagina Monologues]]''.{{cite web|url=http://sapnamagazine.com/2005/our-vaginas-have-monolugues-too-breaking-the-silence-one-yoni-at-a-time/|title=Our Vaginas Have Monolugues, Too: Breaking the Silence, One Yoni at a Time|author=|first=|date=|work=Sapna Magazine: South Asian American Women|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160503033334/http://sapnamagazine.com/2005/our-vaginas-have-monolugues-too-breaking-the-silence-one-yoni-at-a-time/|archive-date=2016-05-03|dead-url=|accessdate=March 6, 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.foundsf.org/index.php?title=Yoni_Ki_Baat:_South_Asian_Queer_and_Feminist_Organizing|title=Yoni Ki Baat: South Asian Queer and Feminist Organizing|last=Bharat|first=Omsri|date=2015|website=FoundSF|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-04}} Pieces can be performed by the writer, or by another performer, sometimes anonymously.{{Cite journal|last=Makker|first=Vandana|date=May 29, 2004|title=If My Vagina Could Speak...|url=http://www.samarmagazine.org/archive/articles/157|journal=SAMAR|volume=|pages=|via=}} Since its launch, ''YKB'' has been continuously performed across the United States. ''Yoni Ki Baat'' was developed in 2003 by South Asian Sisters, a non-profit collective of South Asian women based in the [[San Francisco Bay Area]].{{cite web|url=http://cms.boloji.com/index.cfm?md=Content&sd=Articles&ArticleID=7417|title=South Asian Women in America Talk Sex, Break Myths by Vandana Makker|author=|first=|date=|work=Boloji|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170723213231/http://cms.boloji.com/index.cfm?md=Content&sd=Articles&ArticleID=7417|archive-date=2017-07-23|dead-url=|accessdate=2017-07-23}} Co-founders Maulie Dass, Sapna Shahani, and Vandana Makker sent out a call in February 2003, and described receiving an outpouring of submissions.{{Cite news|url=http://theaerogram.com/yoni-ki-baat-vagina-monologues-inspired-celebration-south-asian-women/|title=‘Yoni Ki Baat’: A ‘Vagina Monologues’-Inspired Celebration of South Asian Women|last=Luhar|first=Monica|date=2014-03-17|work=The Aerogram|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.indolink.com/displayArticleS.php?id=120306062833|title=‘Yoni Ki Baat’ Spotlights Desi Diaspora Women's Sexuality|last=Assisi|first=Francis C.|date=2007-01-02|website=IndoLink|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070102142008/http://www.indolink.com/displayArticleS.php?id=120306062833|archive-date=2007-01-02|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-04}} The first public performances in July 2003 at [[University of California, Berkeley|UC Berkeley]] included monologues dealing with abuse, menstruation, masturbation, orgasms, marriage, religious faith, and political protest. According to co-founder Vandana Makker:
"''Yoni Ki Baat'' allows individuals who identify as women of South Asian ancestry the space to share their stories around issues that are often 'taboo' (and therefore not discussed) in our communities. Stories around sex, body image, abuse, violence. Stories around sex, body image, abuse, violence, pleasure, hair, relationships, bodily functions, strong emotions—pleasure, hair, relationships, bodily functions, strong emotions—those things we often can’t even admit to ourselves. These are the stories that we seek out and then perform on stage. Sometimes the writers perform their own pieces and sometimes we have other women perform them. In the spirit of ''The Vagina Monologues'', a portion of the proceeds from each show are donated to organizations that support survivors of domestic violence."
''Yoni Ki Baat'' performances and spinoffs have been performed in various parts of the United States by campus organizations and local South Asian organizations, sometimes borrowing scripts from South Asian Sisters, holding calls for submissions, or a combination of the two. The majority of proceeds are donated to organizations supporting survivors of domestic violence in the South Asian community. In addition to South Asian Sisters' regular performances in the San Francisco Bay Area, ''YKB'' has been staged in [[New York City]],{{Cite news|url=http://yonikiraat.wixsite.com/yonikiraat|title=Yoni Ki Raat|work=Yoni Ki Raat|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en}} [[Seattle]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.seattleglobalist.com/2017/03/16/yoni-ki-baat-vagina-monologues-seattle-2017/63560|title=Yoni Ki Baat: Where skeptics learn to trust|date=2017-03-16|work=The Seattle Globalist|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en-US}} [[Chicago]],{{Cite web|url=http://events.sulekha.com/yoni-ki-baat-2018_event-in_naperville-il_330589|title=Yoni Ki Baat - 2018 at North Central College Meiley Swallow Hal, Naperville, IL|last=|first=|date=|website=events.sulekha.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-04}} [[Madison, Wisconsin|Madison]],{{Cite web|url=https://union.wisc.edu/events-and-activities/event-calendar/event/yoni-ki-baat-intersectional-stories-from-womyn-of-color/197/|title=Yoni Ki Baat|last=|first=|date=|website=union.wisc.edu|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-04}} [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]],{{Cite news|url=https://mittalsouthasiainstitute.harvard.edu/2018/04/south-asian-sisters-bring-yoni-ki-baat-to-harvard/|title=South Asian Sisters Bring Yoni Ki Baat to Harvard|last=|first=|date=2018-04-12|work=The Lakshmi Mittal and Family South Asia Institute|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en-US}} [[Ann Arbor, Michigan|Ann Arbor]],{{Cite web|url=https://maizepages.umich.edu/organization/yonikibaat|title=Yoni Ki Baat|last=|first=|date=|website=maizepages.umich.edu|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-04}} [[Worcester, Massachusetts|Worcester]],{{Cite news|url=https://thescarlet.org/15716/larts/yoni-ki-baat-south-asian-vagina-monologues/|title=Yoni Ki Baat: South Asian Vagina Monologues|last=Bilimoria|first=Drashhti|work=The Scarlet|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en-US}} [[Grinnell, Iowa|Grinnell]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.thesandb.com/article/yoni-ki-baat-vulnerable-and-empowering.html|title=Yoni Ki Baat: Vulnerable and Empowering|last=Bohlke|first=Lily|date=October 27, 2017|work=The Scarlet and Black|access-date=2018-09-07}} and [[Palo Alto, California|Palo Alto]].{{Cite news|url=http://shc.stanford.edu/events/yoni-ki-baat-performance-rangmanch|title="Yoni ki Baat"- A Performance by Rangmanch|last=|first=|date=2014-03-03|work=Stanford Humanities|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} [[Category:Monologues]] [[Category:Vagina and vulva in art]] [[Category:Feminist theatre]] [[Category:2003 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:Asian-American art]] [[Category:South Asian American culture]]

revision.comment: I corrected the amount that the UFC was sold for. I am watching an interview with Dana White on Fox News Channel. A show called, Objectified. Dana made a point to say that the, ".025B was very important to him."
revision.text:
{{Update|inaccurate=yes|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox company |name = Zuffa, LLC |logo = ZuffaLogo.jpg |type = [[Subsidiary]] |founders = [[Frank Fertitta III]]
[[Lorenzo Fertitta]] |area_served = |key_people = [[Ari Emanuel]] (Co-CEO)
[[Patrick Whitesell]] (Co-CEO)
[[Dana White]] ([[President (corporate title)|President]]) |industry = Sports promotion |website = www.zuffamma.com |revenue = |operating_income = |net_income = |owner = |num_employees = |parent = [[William Morris Endeavor]] |divisions = |subsid = [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]]
'''Defunct:'''
[[World Fighting Alliance]] (2006)
[[Pride Fighting Championships]] (2007)
[[World Extreme Cagefighting]] (2010)
[[Strikeforce (mixed martial arts)|Strikeforce]] (2013) |footnotes = |foundation = {{Start date and age|2001}} |location_city = [[Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]] |location_country = [[United States]] |slogan = |homepage = |dissolved = }} '''Zuffa, LLC''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|z|uː|f|ə}}) is an American sports promotion company specializing in [[mixed martial arts]]. It was founded in January 2001 in [[Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], by [[Station Casinos]] executives [[Frank Fertitta III]] and [[Lorenzo Fertitta]] to be the parent entity of the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] (UFC) after they purchased it from the Semaphore Entertainment Group. The word "Zuffa" is an [[Italian language|Italian]] word ({{IPA-it|ˈtsuffa|pron}}), meaning "fight". On July 11, 2016, Zuffa announced that it would be purchased by [[WME-IMG]] for the price of $4.025 billion.http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/16970360/ufc-sold-unprecedented-4-billion-dana-white-confirms ==Relationship with MMA organizations== ===International Fight League=== Throughout the existence of the [[International Fight League]] (IFL) between 2006 and 2008, both Zuffa and the IFL had competed in a hostile relationship. Zuffa accused the IFL of and sued them for illegally using proprietary information obtained by hiring executives from the UFC organization. The IFL responded with their own suit claiming that Zuffa was threatening potential partners not to work with the IFL, including [[Fox Sports Net]] (a deal with Fox Sports was later signed before resolution of the suit{{cite web|url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/IFL-Inks-Broadcast-Deal-with-Fox-Sports-Net-4205 |title=IFL Inks Broadcast Deal with Fox Sports Net |publisher=Sherdog.com |date=2006-03-29 |accessdate=2012-08-06}}). The tension between the IFL and the UFC worsened with accusations that the IFL had attempted to buy out several top UFC fighters. In July 2008, there were reports of the IFL's possible purchase by the UFC.{{cite web|author=Corey Lorinsky|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/2008/7/ufc-might-buy-clobbered-international-fight-league-ifli- |title=Hope For KO-ed International Fight League (IFLI): UFC Might Buy It* |publisher=Business Insider |date=2008-07-18 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} That same month, Joe Favorito, former IFL senior vice president, cited financial troubles for the closing of the company on July 31, 2008. Anonymous sources stated that Zuffa had bought the IFL.{{cite web|title=Zuffa purchases IFL|url=http://www.thefightnetwork.com/news/805:zuffa-purchases-ifl/|work=Fight Network|accessdate=1 August 2011}} Other reports cited the UFC's airing of IFL footage on its programming, and the signing of previous IFL fighters, as an indirect confirmation of the purchase.[http://www.5thround.com/07252008/news/1293/ifl-going-goinggone/ ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091201045527/http://www.5thround.com/07252008/news/1293/ifl-going-goinggone/ |date=December 1, 2009 }} ===WFA=== On December 11, 2006, Zuffa acquired the assets of the [[World Fighting Alliance]], and formed WFA Enterprises, LLC. as a subsidiary to handle these assets, including select fighter contracts.{{cite web |url=http://www.ufc.com/index.cfm?fa=news.detail&gid=3959 |title=Subsidiary of Zuffa, LLC Acquires Assets from World Fighting Alliance, Inc |publisher=Ufc.com |date= |accessdate=2012-09-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100410002850/http://www.ufc.com/index.cfm?fa=news.detail&gid=3959 |archivedate=2010-04-10 |df= }} On the same day, it was reported that Zuffa was formalizing plans to buy [[World Extreme Cagefighting]], to be run as a separate promotion from the UFC. ===WEC=== Following the purchase of the [[World Extreme Cagefighting|WEC]], Zuffa made several changes to the promotion. This included modifying the WEC's cage, transferring to a focus on lighter weight classes, giving it the ability to host events in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]], and having the championships of fighters who were contracted UFC fighters vacated. From 2007 to the end of 2010, the WEC was run as a separate promotion under the Zuffa banner, airing events [[WEC 28|28]] to [[WEC 53|53]] on [[Versus (TV channel)|Versus]] in the US and on [[The Score Television Network|The Score]] in Canada. On October 28, 2010, [[Dana White]] announced that the WEC would be absorbed into the UFC in early 2011.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zCIWWLnJSN4&feature=sub |title=Exclusive: Dana White Announces UFC-WEC Merger |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}} ===Pride Fighting Championships=== {{main|Pride Fighting Championships#Pride Worldwide era}} On March 27, 2007, it was announced that [[Frank Fertitta III]] and [[Lorenzo Fertitta]] were acquiring the assets of [[Pride Fighting Championships]], the UFC's largest rival, from [[Dream Stage Entertainment]]. To handle the take over, the Fertitta brothers created a new corporate entity to handle the assets, Pride FC Worldwide Holdings LLC. With common ownership in place, Zuffa and Pride Worldwide would be working closely together.[http://www.mmaweekly.com/absolutenm/templates/dailynews.asp?articleid=3053&zoneid=13 ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929111019/http://www.mmaweekly.com/absolutenm/templates/dailynews.asp?articleid=3053&zoneid=13 |date=September 29, 2007 }} Although goals of reviving Pride were not realized, many of Pride's assets, including contracts with fighters and intellectual property, are now regularly utilized by the UFC. ===Strikeforce=== ====Early relationship (2008–2010)==== Starting around 2008, UFC president Dana White began a long media battle with their main competitor, [[Strikeforce (mixed martial arts)|Strikeforce]], and their main media partner, [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]. White had expressed that he had "no beef with Strikeforce", instead indicating a greater dislike for Showtime, and Ken Hershman in particular. However, White did express in an interview that he had a mutual relationship with Strikeforce founder and CEO [[Scott Coker]], explaining that Coker was caught up in his battle with Showtime. ====2011 acquisition and beyond (2011–2013)==== On March 1, 2011, Scott Coker was noted for dismissing rumors of a pending sale to Zuffa as "crazy." Coker went on to explain that Strikeforce was searching for "strategic partners" and that there were at least two (some reports say three) potential investors, but that "the UFC is not one of them."{{cite web|last=Prophet |first=Zombie |url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2011/3/13/2047456/ufc-strikeforce-acquisition-more-details-emerge |title=More Details Emerge on UFC Acquisition of Strikeforce |publisher=Bloody Elbow |date=2011-03-13 |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web|last=Chiappetta |first=Mike |url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2011/03/30/the-anatomy-of-the-zuffa-strikeforce-deal/ |title=The Anatomy of the Zuffa-Strikeforce Deal |publisher=MMA Fighting |date=2011-03-30 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} One of the potential investors has been documented to have been [[ProElite]].{{cite web|author=Josh GrossMMAArchive |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/extra/mma/news/story?id=6209923 |title=UFC parent company Zuffa buys rival MMA promoter Strikeforce - ESPN |publisher=Sports.espn.go.com |date=2011-03-13 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} However, on March 12, 2011, it was announced in an interview of Dana White by journalist [[Ariel Helwani]] that Zuffa had purchased Strikeforce.{{cite web|last=Helwani |first=Ariel |url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2011/03/12/zuffa-purchases-strikeforce/ |title=Zuffa Purchases Strikeforce |publisher=MMA Fighting |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web|last=Whitman |first=Mike |url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/articles/Zuffa-Purchases-Strikeforce-30800 |title=Zuffa Purchases Strikeforce |publisher=Sherdog.com |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web |url=http://mmajunkie.com/news/22807/ufc-purchases-strikeforce.mma |title=UFC purchases Strikeforce; UFC boss says organizations to operate independently |publisher=MMAjunkie.com |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120731021112/http://mmajunkie.com/news/22807/ufc-purchases-strikeforce.mma |archivedate=2012-07-31 |df= }}{{cite web |last=Stupp |first=Dann |url=http://mmajunkie.com/news/22822/ufc-officially-announces-strikeforce-purchase-fertitta-says-coker-to-run-promotion.mma |title=UFC officially announces Strikeforce purchase, Fertitta says Coker to run promotion |publisher=MMAjunkie.com |date=2011-03-14 |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023144456/http://mmajunkie.com/news/22822/ufc-officially-announces-strikeforce-purchase-fertitta-says-coker-to-run-promotion.mma |archivedate=2012-10-23 |df= }} The deal was made between Zuffa and partial Strikeforce owner [[Silicon Valley Sports and Entertainment]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mixedmartialarts.com/news/309950/Coker-tried-failed-to-get-control-of-Strikeforce/ |title=Coker tried, failed to get control of Strikeforce - Mixed Martial Arts News |publisher=Mixedmartialarts.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}} The amount of money involved has not been officially disclosed, however, it has been reported that the deal was worth $40 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.mixedmartialarts.com/news/309911/Zuffa-reportedly-paid-40-million-for-Strikeforce/ |title=Zuffa reportedly paid $40 million for Strikeforce - Mixed Martial Arts News |publisher=Mixedmartialarts.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}} Sources have confirmed that Scott Coker attempted to not sell Strikeforce to Zuffa. However, Coker ultimately failed and agreed to sell Strikeforce's licensing rights, fighter contracts, and video library to Zuffa on March 10 or 11. On March 14, 2011, Zuffa held a conference call to officially announce the acquisition of Strikeforce.{{cite web|last=Chiappetta |first=Mike |url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2011/03/14/ufc-purchases-strikeforce-conference-call-twitter-updates/ |title=Zuffa Purchases Strikeforce Conference Call Twitter Updates |publisher=MMA Fighting |date=2011-03-14 |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web|last=Prophet |first=Zombie |url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2011/3/14/2049812/ufc-purchases-strikeforce-conference-call-live-updates-dana-white |title=UFC Purchases Strikeforce Conference Call Live Updates |publisher=Bloody Elbow |date=2011-03-14 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} On March 28, 2011, Scott Coker stated that he felt that the acquisition would be good for the sport of mixed martial arts. This was in contradiction of his original resistance of selling Strikeforce to Zuffa.{{cite web|author=Sherdog.com |url=http://sherdogblog.craveonline.com/blog/2011-03-28 |title=Sherdog.com MMA Blog: Monday, March 28, 2011 |website=Web.archive.org |date= |accessdate=2016-03-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111008170933/http://sherdogblog.craveonline.com/blog/2011-03-28 |archivedate=October 8, 2011 }} Ultimately, Strikeforce was operated as a separate company, similar to that of the WEC, until January 12, 2013, when the final Strikeforce show was held in [[Oklahoma City]]. After which, the promotion was dissolved, and all fighter contracts were either ended or absorbed into the UFC. ===United Glory=== When [[United Glory]] was originally formed in 2006, it was known as Ultimate Glory before a lawsuit with Zuffa forced a name change.{{cite web|last=Leidecker |first=Tim |url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/articles/European-Throwdown-Overeem-Goodridge-in-Works-14278 |title=European Throwdown: Overeem-Goodridge in Works |publisher=Sherdog.com |date=2008-09-04 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} ===Invicta Fighting Championships=== In June 2014 the UFC announced that they had signed a multi-year, multi-event broadcast deal to show and archive all [[Invicta FC]] events on [[UFC Fight Pass]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ufc.com/news/ufc-fight-pass-incivta-deal|title=UFC FIGHT PASS signs historic content deal with Invicta FC|work=UFC}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2014/6/5/5784496/ufc-inks-distribution-deal-of-all-invicta-events-for-fight-pass|title=UFC inks distribution deal of all Invicta events for Fight Pass|author=Dave Meltzer|date=6 June 2014|work=MMA Fighting}} This has allowed the UFC to further expand its women's divisions by adding a [[Minimumweight|strawweight]] division in July 2014, and signing Invicta fighters such as [[Carla Esparza]] and [[Felice Herrig]]. ===Shooto=== In June 2014 the UFC announced that they had signed a development deal with the recently revived, [[Vale Tudo Japan]]. A brand that was brought back in 2012 by the long running, [[Shooto]] promotion.{{cite web|url=http://www.ufc.com/news/ufc-signs-development-deal-with-shooto-in-japan|title=UFC and Japan's VTJ Sign Historic Deal|work=UFC}}{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/ufc/story/ufc-signs-developmental-deal-with-shooto-in-japan-062614|title=UFC signs developmental deal with SHOOTO in Japan|author=Fox Sports|work=FOX Sports}} The UFC plans on promoting and operating a new tournament series that will focus on [[Bantamweight (MMA)|135]] and [[Featherweight (MMA)|145]] pound divisions. There were plans of a ''[[The Ultimate Fighter]]''-like TV show to help promote these tournaments but it is unclear on what the status remains on it.{{cite web|url=http://fansided.com/2014/06/26/ufc-partners-former-shooto-promotion/|title=UFC partners with former Shooto promotion|work=FanSided}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2014/6/26/5844564/ufc-partners-with-vale-tudo-japan-for-tv-show-and-tournament|title=UFC partners with Vale Tudo Japan for TV show and tournament|author=Dave Meltzer|date=26 June 2014|work=MMA Fighting}} ==Relationship With non-MMA organizations== ===Flash Entertainment=== On January 12, 2010, Zuffa sold a minority interest in the company to Flash Entertainment. The company announced the completion of a deal in which a 10-percent interest in the company to the [[Abu Dhabi]] government-owned Flash Entertainment. With the sale, company ownership would be 40.5 percent held by Lorenzo Fertitta, the company’s CEO and chairman, 40.5 percent held by his older brother, Frank Fertitta III, 10 percent by Flash Entertainment and nine percent by Dana White.{{cite web|publisher=[[Yahoo! Sports]] |title=Minority interest sold in UFC parent company|date=2010-01-12|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/mma/news;_ylt=Agxw5u99vxeUPmUsCLrIg3c5nYcB?slug=dm-ufcsale011210&prov=yhoo&type=lgnsl|accessdate=2010-01-12}} Flash Entertainment was formed in 2008 by the Abu Dhabi government’s Executive Affairs Authority. ===Ubisoft=== In December 2010, Zuffa filed a lawsuit against [[video game publisher]] [[Ubisoft]], for what they claimed was a violation of trademark on the game, ''Fighters Uncaged'', packaging.{{cite news|last=Sieroty|first=Chris|title=UFC sues video game maker, alleging harm to trademark|url=http://www.lvrj.com/business/ufc-sues-video-game-maker-alleging-harm-to-trademark-111715579.html?ref=579|accessdate=26 September 2011|newspaper=Las Vegas Review Journal|date=11 December 2010}} On the packaging of the game the trademarked term, "Ultimate Fighting" is shown in all capital letters. Zuffa claimed that the use of the term is identical or confusingly similar to the use of the UFC's trademarks. While Ubisoft failed to provide any comments on the lawsuit,{{cite web|author=December 14, 2010 1:03PM PST |url=http://www.gamespot.com/xbox360/action/fightersuncaged/news.html?sid=6285399&om_act=convert&om_clk=newsfeatures&tag=newsfeatures;title;1 |title=UFC parent sues Ubisoft |publisher=GameSpot.com |date=2010-11-04 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} by August 2011, the two companies announced the dissolution of the lawsuit.{{cite web|last=Whitman |first=Mike |url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/Zuffa-Ubisoft-Settle-Infringement-Suit-35058 |title=Zuffa, Ubisoft Settle Infringement Suit |publisher=Sherdog.com |date=2011-08-25 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} ===Lone Survivor Foundation=== In May 2011, it was announced that Zuffa would be holding a charity auction featuring more than 100 items to benefit the [[Lone Survivor Foundation]] during the last week of May 2011.{{cite web |url=http://mmajunkie.com/news/23684/ufc-offers-more-than-100-items-for-charity-auction-to-benefit-lone-survivor-foundation.mma |title=UFC offers more than 100 items for charity auction to benefit Lone Survivor Foundation |publisher=MMAjunkie.com |date=2011-05-21 |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023191546/http://mmajunkie.com/news/23684/ufc-offers-more-than-100-items-for-charity-auction-to-benefit-lone-survivor-foundation.mma |archivedate=2012-10-23 |df= }} All products were autographed by UFC fighters and included [[baseball cap]]s, [[T-shirt]]s, [[MMA gloves]], and [[DVD]]s. Products generally ranged in price from $50 to a few thousand dollars. ===Cleveland Clinic brain trauma study=== In February 2014, Zuffa was one of a number of major combat sport promotions to support a major brain trauma study that was being conducted by the [[Cleveland Clinic]].{{cite web|url=http://cagepages.com/2014/02/07/ufc-help-cleveland-clinics-study-brain-study/|title=UFC to help Cleveland Clinic's Study on Brain Trauma|work=Cage Pages}}{{cite web|url=http://ringtv.craveonline.com/news/317079-do-not-run-until-tuesday-brain-health-supported-by-richard-schaefer-todd-duboef-bernard-hopkins|title=Study unites Golden Boy, Top Rank, MMA, U.S. Senators|author=Lem Satterfield|date=4 February 2014|work=Ring TV}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2014/1/27/5351822/mma-and-boxing-luminaries-combine-efforts-help-cleveland-clinic-brain|title=MMA and boxing luminaries combine efforts to help Cleveland Clinic brain health study|author=Luke Thomas|date=27 January 2014|work=MMA Fighting}}{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/ufc/story/ufc-teams-up-with-senators-mccain-reid-to-support-brain-health-study-at-the-cleveland-clinic-020114|title=MMA and boxing execs, Senators McCain and Reid team up to support brain health study|author=Fox Sports|work=FOX Sports}}{{cite web|url=http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2014/feb/05/study-head-injuries-boxing/|title=Boxing and MMA officials join Reid and McCain to tout study of fighters' brain health|author=Karoun Demirjian|work=LasVegasSun.com}}{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/ufc/story/mma-boxing-rivals-unify-to-support-head-trauma-research-we-owe-it-to-these-athletes-020414|title=MMA, boxing rivals unify to support head trauma research: 'We owe it to these athletes'|author=Fox Sports|work=FOX Sports}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2014/02/boxers_and_politicians_stop_fi.html|title=Boxers and politicians stop fighting to support Cleveland Clinic brain injury study (video)|work=cleveland.com}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/boxing/story/_/id/10402924/boxing-mma-representatives-meet-head-research|title=Boxing, MMA representatives meet about head research|work=ESPN.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/news/boxing-mma-organizations-promise-funding-brain-study-las-vegas|title=Boxing, MMA organizations promise funding for brain study in Las Vegas|work=Las Vegas Review-Journal}}{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/feb/4/boxing-mma-groups-back-brain-trauma-study/|title=Boxing, MMA groups back brain trauma study|work=The Washingtion Times}} This was further followed up in February 2016, when Zuffa donated a million dollars to the [[Lou Ruvo Center for Brain Health|Ruvo Center]].http://www.reviewjournal.com/life/health/ufc-donates-1m-ruvo-center-brain-trauma-study-video ==MMA regulations== The current rules used in the UFC were first established by the [[New Jersey Athletic Control Board]] in 2000, in consultation with the UFC and other MMA promotions in the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.state.nj.us/lps/sacb/docs/martial.html |title=NJ State Athletic Control Board - Proposed Rules - Rules Governing Boxing, Extreme Wrestling and Sparring Exhibitions and Performance Bond Procedure |publisher=State.nj.us |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090403062008/http://www.state.nj.us/lps/sacb/docs/martial.html |archivedate=April 3, 2009 }} The first UFC event under the new rules was [[UFC 28]], held before Zuffa's takeover. New Jersey's ''Unified Rules of Mixed Martial Arts'' has since been established throughout the country by other state athletic commissions, including Nevada and California. The UFC has, however, kept close ties with state commissions, especially the [[Nevada Athletic Commission|Nevada State Athletic Commission]], of which Lorenzo Fertitta is a former board member.{{cite web |url=http://www.ufc.com/index.cfm?fa=LearnUFC.FactSheet |title=The Official Website of the Ultimate Fighting Championship® |publisher=UFC |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100627235500/http://www.ufc.com/index.cfm?fa=learnufc.factsheet |archivedate=2010-06-27 |df= }} ==Drug policy efforts== During the early years of [[mixed martial arts]], when [[Pride Fighting Championships]] along with the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] were early premierships of the sport, it has been documented that there was a noteworthy lack of rules and regulations regarding drug testing for [[Performance-enhancing drugs|PED's]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/7/20/5920195/enson-inoue-pride-contract-shows-no-steroid-testing-mma-news|title=Enson Inoue’s PRIDE FC contract highlights lack of steroid testing|author=Kyle McLachlan|date=20 July 2014|work=Bloody Elbow}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bjpenn.com/pride-contract-stated-fighters-could-use-steroids/|title=PRIDE Contract Stated Fighters Could Use Steroids|work=- BJPenn.com UFC Fight News & Videos}}{{cite web|url=http://www.scifighting.com/2013/09/02/10716/steroids-in-pride-a-retrospective/|title=Steroids In Pride: A Retrospective|author=Adam Brennan|date=2 September 2013|work=SciFighting}} This led to a widespread debate and discussion regarding how prevalent the use of steroids were in the sport, as well as a long list of competitors in the UFC and other major organizations facing failed drug tests.{{cite web|url=http://www.cagepotato.com/mma-steroid-busts-definitive-timeline/|title=MMA Steroid Busts: The Definitive Timeline [UPDATED With Testosterone Busts]|publisher=}} This was further highlighted by continued problems with UFC champions, including [[Jon Jones]] and [[Anderson Silva]], failing drug tests.{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/12197656/jon-jones-ufc-no-room-cocaine-addict|title=Jon Jones of UFC -- 'No room to be cocaine addict'|work=ESPN.com}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/12338927/anderson-silva-fails-second-drug-test|title=Anderson Silva fails second drug test|work=ESPN.com}} So in February 2015, Zuffa announced a more aggressive year round, random-testing approach for its competitors to begin in July 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.ufc.com/news/ufc-officials-unveil-plans-for-more-robust-drug-testing-of-athletes|title=UFC Officials Unveil Plans For More Robust Drug Testing Of Athletes|work=UFC}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/12343412/ufc-drug-test-fighters-year-round-part-new-anti-doping-plan|title=UFC to drug test fighters year-round as part of new anti-doping plan|work=ESPN.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2015/2/17/8045981/ufcs-decisions-regarding-peds-will-change-direction-of-the-sport|title=UFC's decisions regarding PEDs will change direction of the sport|author=Dave Meltzer|date=18 February 2015|work=MMA Fighting}} ==Anti-piracy efforts== Zuffa has been one of the largest and most aggressive spenders among anti-piracy political [[Lobbying|lobbyists]] in the United States since the end of the 2000s.{{cite news| url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/sports/mma/post/2012-05-18/ufc-among-sports-big-spenders-with-dc-lobbyists/697054/1 | work=USA Today | title=Updated monthly | date=2012-05-18}} One thing in particular that sets them apart from other sports leagues is that, in addition to supporting efforts of stricter piracy laws, they have also on numerous occasions gone after selected individuals in addition to pirate hosting websites.{{cite web|url=http://combatsportslaw.com/2014/03/10/zuffa-v-piracy-expensive-lessons-in-summarydefault-judgements/|title=Zuffa v. Piracy – Expensive Lessons in Default Judgement|work=Combat Sports Law}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2012/3/13/2868272/ufc-piracy-legal-zuffa-streaming|title=UFC Taking Action Against Individuals Who Illegally Stream Events|author=Brent Brookhouse|date=13 March 2012|work=Bloody Elbow}} Some of the most notable cases have included, a well publicized lawsuit with [[Justin.tv]] in 2011{{cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2011/01/21/ufc-sues-justin-tv-says-50-000-people-viewed-ufc-121-illegally|title=UFC Sues Justin.tv, Says 50,000 People Viewed UFC 121 Illegally|author=Michael David Smith|date=21 January 2011|work=MMA Fighting}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmaweekly.com/pirates-beware-zuffa-files-lawsuit-against-justin-tv-for-alleged-illegal-ufc-video-uploading|title=Pirates Beware! Zuffa Files Lawsuit Against Justin.tv For Alleged Illegal UFC Video Uploading|work=Cdn.mmaweekly.com|accessdate=2016-03-09}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmamania.com/2012/3/22/2893430/ufc-lawsuit-justin-tv-not-guilty-internet-piracy-online-video-stream-sopa|title=Courts find Justin.tv not guilty of 'stealing cable' in lawsuit filed by UFC|author=Jesse Holland|date=22 March 2012|work=MMAmania.com}} and a $32 million settlement involving a New York man in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/sports/mma-ufc/ufc-targets-new-york-man-crackdown-piracy|title=UFC targets New York man in crackdown on piracy|author=ALAN SNEL LAS VEGAS REVIEW-JOURNAL|work=Las Vegas Review-Journal}}{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/ufc/haymaker/zuffa-reaches-settlement-in-32-million-lawsuit-against-ppv-pirate-091214|title=Zuffa reaches settlement in $32 million lawsuit against PPV pirate|author=Fox Sports|work=FOX Sports}} Zuffa has always maintained the stance that the large amounts of illegal streams of their events causes massive financial losses.{{cite web|url=http://www.bjpenn.com/ufc-confirms-theyre-losing-millions-from-piracy/|title=UFC Confirms They're Losing Millions From Piracy - BJPenn.com UFC Fight News & Videos|work=- BJPenn.com UFC Fight News & Videos|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141225044638/http://www.bjpenn.com/ufc-confirms-theyre-losing-millions-from-piracy/|archivedate=2014-12-25|df=}} In response to having such a stringent stance it has been extremely controversial and has caused a number of debates within the mixed martial arts community on its effectiveness.{{cite web|url=https://www.techdirt.com/articles/20120320/10225718173/ufc-makes-awful-decision-to-sue-some-its-biggest-fans.shtml|title=UFC Makes The Awful Decision To Sue Some Of Its Biggest Fans|work=Techdirt.}} As a result, the UFC began experimenting on an online subscription model known as UFC Fight Pass in 2014. It is unclear how beneficial the service has been since its emphasis has been largely minimal next to UFC's partnership with [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] and noticeable decline in average PPV buyrates, highlighted by the [[Standard & Poor's|S&P]] downgrading Zuffa's credit rating in late 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/10/12/6965831/standard-poors-downgrades-zuffa-credit-rating-after-rough-2014|title=Standard & Poors downgrades Zuffa credit rating after rough 2014|author=Zane Simon|date=12 October 2014|work=Bloody Elbow}} ==Insurance policy== On May 9, 2011 it was announced that Zuffa would be providing year-round customized insurance coverage for any injury suffered by a [[Ultimate Fighting Championship|UFC]] or Strikeforce athlete.{{cite web|last=Chiappetta |first=Mike |url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2011/05/09/ufc-executives-detail-new-insurance-plan-fighters-managers-rea/ |title=UFC Execs, Fighters and Managers Discuss New Insurance Plan |publisher=MMA Fighting |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite news|last=Non|first=Sergio|title=UFC broadens health coverage for fighters|url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/mma/post/2011/05/ufc-broadens-health-coverage-for-fighters/1|accessdate=30 September 2011|newspaper=USA Today|date=9 May 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://mmaweekly.com/details-about-zuffas-new-fighter-insurance-and-coverage-for |title=Details About Zuffa’s New Fighter Insurance and Coverage for UFC and Strikeforce |publisher=MMAWeekly.com |date=2011-05-09 |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web|last=Con |first=Genghis |url=http://www.mmamania.com/2011/5/9/2162589/hurts-so-good-new-details-emerge-about-the-ufc-health-insurance-plan |title=Hurts so good: New details emerge about the UFC health insurance plan |publisher=MMAmania.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06}}{{cite web |last=Cordero |first=Angel R. |url=http://themmatruth.com/articles/ufc-announces-unprecedented-accident-insurance-coverage-for-its-athletes |title=UFC Announces Unprecedented Accident Insurance Coverage for Its Athletes |publisher=Themmatruth.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120808233814/http://themmatruth.com/articles/ufc-announces-unprecedented-accident-insurance-coverage-for-its-athletes |archivedate=2012-08-08 |df= }}{{cite news|last=Helwani|first=Ariel|title=Zuffa to offer accident insurance to all 350 contracted fighters|url=http://nbcsports.msnbc.com/id/42964079/ns/sports-mma/|accessdate=30 September 2011|newspaper=NBC Sports|date=9 May 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/Zuffa-Expands-Fighter-Insurance-to-Cover-Training-Injuries-32204 |title=Zuffa Expands Fighter Insurance to Cover Training Injuries |publisher=Sherdog.com |date=2011-05-09 |accessdate=2012-08-06}} The policy covers any injuries that occur during competition, training, and non-training related accidents. The policy was underwritten by Houston-based specialty insurance group [[HCC Insurance Holdings]] and went into effect on June 1, 2011. The details of the policy include: * Coverage for all athletes signed by the UFC or Strikeforce. * Coverage for athletes residing both within and outside of the United States. * Zuffa paying for all premiums for the policy, with athletes not required to pay anything. * Allowing athletes to use up to $50,000 in annual coverage for any injuries that occur while under contract to Zuffa. This includes services such as, doctor services, laboratory tests, emergency medical evacuation, and physical therapy. * Coverage for athletes regardless of if they are scheduled to compete. * Life and dental insurance at no cost to the athletes. * No coverage for minor illnesses, but training-related illnesses like [[staph infections]] are covered. An insurance policy is not a first for mixed martial arts or [[combat sports]] as a whole. Former promotions such as the [[International Fight League]], offered insurance to its athletes. However Zuffa's policy is the first to cover a large group of combat sport athletes. According to UFC president [[Dana White]], the policy was a goal of the company since Zuffa first purchased the UFC in 2001. In addition UFC chairman and [[Chief executive officer|CEO]], [[Lorenzo Fertitta]] stated that the policy took three years to establish while trying to find possible insurers. Prior to the introduction of this policy, Zuffa provided up to $100,000 for an athlete on each event to cover injuries sustained during competition. However, if an athlete was injured outside of competition they would have to pay for their own medical expenses. Notable incidents where UFC athletes were injured outside of competition include, * [[Frank Mir]], who was struck by a car while riding his motorcycle in 2004, and forced out of competition for over 20 months. * [[Brock Lesnar]], who was forced out of action for several months while struggling with [[diverticulitis]]. ==Monopoly accusations== The Ultimate Fighting Championship has been accused of monopolistic business practices both in casual criticism{{cite web|url=http://nerdreactor.com/2011/03/12/its-official-ufc-is-a-monopoly/|title=It’s Official, UFC Is a Monopoly|work=Nerd Reactor}}{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1122107-ufc-opinion-how-having-a-monopoly-can-hurt-mma|title=UFC|author=Montique David|work=Bleacher Report}}{{cite web|url=http://themmacorner.com/2014/01/24/industry-dominance-the-ufc-and-its-monopoly-in-the-mma-market/|title=Industry Dominance: UFC And Its ‘Monopoly’ In The MMA Market|author=Greg Byron|work=The MMA Corner}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/6/30/5846330/ufc-monopoly-panel-discussion-paul-gift-david-dudley|title=Panel discussion: Is the UFC a Monopoly?|author=John S. Nash|date=30 June 2014|work=Bloody Elbow}} and in formal lawsuits for a number of years. There are numerous fighters who have accused the company of various wrongdoing's regarding issues including unequal pay, predatory actions toward rival promotions, lack of a [[pension]] or [[Trade union|union]] safety net, and other perceived unethical business practices. These perceptions have been most highlighted by a [[Federal Trade Commission]] investigation that took place between 2011 and 2012. As well as in a series of class action lawsuits filed against the company in late 2014 and early 2015. ===Federal Trade Commission investigation=== In the months following the March 2011 acquisition of rival promotion Strikeforce, rumours began to circulate that a possible investigation by the FTC would take place.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxinginsider.com/columns/mma-rumors-surge-regarding-an-ftc-investigation-of-zuffaufc/|title=MMA: Rumors Surge Regarding an FTC Investigation of Zuffa/UFC - BoxingInsider.com|work=BoxingInsider.com}} These rumours later came to be true when it was officially announced around the end of January 2012 that the FTC had in fact conducted an investigation, and found no wrongdoings regarding the UFC being a monopoly.{{cite web|url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/FTC-Closes-Investigation-of-UFC-Parent-Company-Zuffa-39817|title=FTC Closes Investigation of UFC Parent Company Zuffa|work=Sherdog}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/7525483/ftc-closes-probe-ufc-strikeforce-purchase-take-further-action|title=FTC closes probe of UFC's Strikeforce purchase, won't take further action|work=ESPN.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mixedmartialarts.com/news/381842/FTC-closes-monopoly-investigation-of-UFC|title=FTC closes monopoly investigation of UFC|date=1 February 2012|work=The Underground}} ===Class action lawsuits=== '''2014''' On December 16, 2014 a class action lawsuit was filed against Zuffa by fighters [[Cung Le]], [[Jon Fitch]] and [[Nate Quarry]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/ClassAction-Lawsuit-Filed-Against-UFC-by-Cung-Le-Jon-Fitch-Nate-Quarry-78853|title=Class-Action Lawsuit Filed Against UFC by Cung Le, Jon Fitch, Nate Quarry|work=Sherdog}}{{cite news| url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/early-lead/wp/2014/12/18/ufc-fighters-file-class-action-lawsuit-accusing-mixed-martial-arts-promotion-of-violating-anti-trust-laws/ | work=The Washington Post | first=Marissa | last=Payne | title=UFC fighters file class-action lawsuit accusing mixed martial arts promotion of violating anti-trust laws | date=2014-12-18}} Within a few days, [[Javier Vazquez (fighter)|Javier Vazquez]] and [[Dennis Hallman]] filed a second class action.{{cite web|url=http://mmajunkie.com/2014/12/dennis-hallman-javier-vasquez-join-class-action-lawsuit-against-ufc|title=Dennis Hallman, Javier Vasquez join class-action lawsuit against UFC|work=MMAjunkie}} And on December 24, [[Brandon Vera]] and [[Pablo Garza (fighter)|Pablo Garza]] filed a third lawsuit.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/12/24/7448055/brandon-vera-and-pablo-garza-file-third-class-action-suit-on|title=Brandon Vera and Pablo Garza File Third Class Action Suit on Christmas Eve|author=John S. Nash|date=24 December 2014|work=Bloody Elbow}} Shortly after the initial news spreading, Zuffa quickly responded following the first class action with the statement that, "The UFC will vigorously defend itself and its business practices."{{cite web|url=http://mmajunkie.com/2014/12/ufc-promises-to-vigorously-defend-itself-against-class-action-suit|title=UFC promises to ‘vigorously’ defend itself against class-action suit - MMAjunkie|work=MMAjunkie}} This soon led other promoters such as [[Scott Coker]], President of [[Bellator MMA]], expressing an interest in the outcome of the lawsuit, while rejecting his organization as being labeled a "minor league" as was done several times in the initial filing.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/12/26/7450619/ufc-bellator-scott-coker-interested-outcome-ufc-lawsuit-bellator-not-minor-league-mma-news|title=Scott Coker interested in outcome of UFC class-action lawsuit, says Bellator is not a ‘minor league’|author=Karim Zidan|date=26 December 2014|work=Bloody Elbow}} By the end of December 2014, the UFC made a formal statement stating, "We are proud of the company we have built, confident in our legal position, and intend to prevail in this lawsuit."{{cite web|url=http://www.ufc.com/news/ufc-statement-2|title=UFC Statement|work=UFC}} '''2015''' On February 7, 2015, a fourth lawsuit was filed against the UFC, this one by [[Mac Danzig]] and [[Gabe Ruediger]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fightofthenight.com/news/mac-danzig-and-gabe-ruediger-file-lawsuit-against-zuffa|title=Mac Danzig And Gabe Ruediger File Lawsuit Against Zuffa|author=Jason Henderson|date=7 February 2015|work=Fight of the Night}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mymmanews.com/lawsuits-piling-zuffa-additional-former-ufc-fighters/|title=Lawsuits piling up on ZUFFA, additional fighters sue|work=My MMA News.com}} It was around this time that Zuffa motioned to move the hearing date from May 7 to March 26, as well as to move the venue from Northern California to Las Vegas, where they are headquartered.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/2/3/7968899/ufc-lawsuit-details-full-documents-on-zuffas-motion-to-transfer/in/7162628|title=UFC Lawsuit: Details and full documents on Zuffa's Motion to transfer venue, and advance hearing date|author=Anton Tabuena|date=3 February 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} A few weeks later, Zuffa motioned to have the lawsuits dismissed, in four separate documents they claim, "The Complaints' vague and conclusory allegations fall far short of the Supreme Court's requirements in [[Bell Atlantic Corp. v. Twombly]], for pleading specific facts showing a plausible antitrust claim."{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/2/28/8125455/mma-ufc-zuffa-motion-to-dismiss-antitrust-lawsuit-fighters|title=UFC files motion to dismiss fighter antitrust lawsuit|author=Paul Gift|date=28 February 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} Shortly thereafter, a fifth lawsuit was added by [[Kyle Kingsbury]] and [[Darren Uyenoyama]] on March 20, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/3/21/8268695/ufc-lawsuit-two-more-fighters-file-antitrust-complaint-against-zuffa|title=UFC Lawsuit: Two more fighters file antitrust complaint against Zuffa|author=John S. Nash|date=21 March 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} On April 12, the plaintiff athletes filed an opposition to February's motion to dismiss and transfer.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/4/12/8390411/fighters-opposition-to-motion-to-dismiss-transfer-filed/in/7162628|title=UFC Lawsuit: Fighters file opposition to Zuffa's motion to dismiss & transfer|author=John S. Nash|date=12 April 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} Following the May 7 hearing regarding the motion to change venue, a Californian federal judge granted Zuffa the motion to change venue to Las Vegas after citing contract agreements from the former employees.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/6/3/8717945/ufc-class-action-antitrust-lawsuit-motion-transfer-venue-nevada-mma-news|title=Judge grants UFC's motion to transfer antitrust case to Nevada|author=Paul Gift|date=3 June 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} As a result of the change of venue to Nevada, Zuffa was denied its motion to remain a [[Discovery (law)|discovery]] for 15 years of its financial records.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/5/14/8604095/ufc-fighter-monopoloy-lawsuit-zuffa-files-motion-to-stay-discovery-of-15-years/in/7162628|title=Zuffa files motion to stay discovery of '15 years of Zuffa's financial statements'|author=John S. Nash|date=14 May 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/7/28/9064379/ufc-fighters-lawsuit-judge-denies-motion-discovery-antitrust/in/7162628|title=Judge denies UFC's motion to stay discovery in antitrust lawsuit|author=John S. Nash|date=29 July 2015|work=Bloody Elbow}} Subsequently, following this denial, debate a began on who, what, and how UFC sensitive information should be viewed, especially by MMAFA founder, [http://mmafa.tv/ Rob Maysey].http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/8/28/9221583/ufc-antitrust-lawsuit-discovery-confidential-information-zuffa-vs-maysey-mmafa-mma-legal-news/in/7162628 Both sides have argued for different criteria, so as not to put them at an disadvantage. However, Zuffa has requested a two-tiered system of confidentiality: confidential and highly confidential. They have stated they feel that Maysey's access to highly confidential information could have an influential impact on him and his role in the MMAFA. Meanwhile, Maysey has openly stated his goal is to represent the fighters and ultimately try to get a reform similar to the [[Muhammad Ali Boxing Reform Act|Ali Act]] of 2000.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T3CiNZN7rd4 Moving forward to September 25, 2015, due to the gradual nature and complications regarding the lawsuit; Zuffa requested another dismissal of the case and asked that it be thrown out of Las Vegas federal court. In a surprise bench ruling, this was ultimately denied, which promoted the UFC to release a formal response.http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/9/25/9363209/ufc-loses-motion-to-dismiss-antitrust-lawsuit-mma-news/in/7162628http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/13741330/court-denies-ufc-motion-dismiss-antitrust-lawsuithttp://www.ufc.com/news/UFC-Statement-on-Antitrust-Hearing-in-Las-Vegas The following week, magistrate judge Peggy Leen ruled that the UFC could not prevent plaintiffs attorney Rob Maysey from viewing its most highly confidential and sensitive business and financial information. This has officially caused an expert discovery that is estimated to last from 12–16 months (September 2016 to January 2017).http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/10/1/9430995/ufc-loses-two-motions-discovery-antitrust-lawsuit-mma-news/in/7162628 In doing so, both parties will have to hand over various highly confidential and sensitive documents. The goal of the expert discovery is to determine three key factors for antitrust liability to all hold true: (1) Does the UFC have monopoly power? (2) Did the UFC acquire or maintain such power through exclusionary conduct? (3) Did the UFC cause antitrust injury since having a monopoly is not always illegal in the United States? This is expected to involve a wide range of important figures (past and present) in both mixed martial arts and boxing, including most top ranked [[Ultimate Fighting Championship|UFC]] staff, [[Scott Coker]], [[Bjorn Rebney]], [[Ray Sefo]], [[Frank Shamrock]], [[Fedor Emelianenko]], [[Randy Couture]], [[Ben Askren]], [[Mark Cuban]], [[Oscar De La Hoya]], [[Bob Arum]], [[Lou DiBella]], [[Ken Hershman]], [[Bob Meyrowitz]], and even various [[Pride Fighting Championships|PRIDE FC]] executives. Following this ruling through the end of 2015, both sides have provided well over 100,000 documents.http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2015/11/17/9748132/ufc-lawsuit-update-plaintiffs-argue-discovery-108000-documents-produced-mma-news/in/7162628 '''2016''' Starting in January, the UFC defense team filed its official answer, denying the fighters’ antitrust claims. In an amended complaint, which contained nearly identical legal and economic substance to the original version from December 2014. The only major difference being the number of plaintiff fighters has declined from eleven to six.http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2016/1/20/10796946/antitrust-lawsuit-ufc-files-answer-denying-fighter-claims-mma-news/in/7162628 Pablo Garza, Gabe Ruediger, Darren Uyenoyama, Dennis Hallman, and Mac Danzig all dropped out of the lawsuit while the original three plaintiffs, Cung Le, Nate Quarry, and Jon Fitch, remain along with Brandon Vera, Javier Vazquez, and Kyle Kingsbury. In addition, Zuffa has stood by its point of protecting its brand. And in the latest update, the UFC has inadvertently produced PRIDE FC acquisition materials.http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2016/4/3/11354336/ufc-inadvertently-produced-pride-email-antitrust-lawsuit-mma-news/in/7162628 This has triggered a new debate on whether the material is of value in the lawsuit or can be used as a privileged document. ==Sale to WME-IMG== Around May 11, 2016, [[ESPN|ESPN's]] Darren Rovell reported that [[Goldman Sachs]] was helping Zuffa set up a sale of its majority ownership to one of four bidders at a speculated price range between $3.5 billion to $4 billion.http://espn.go.com/mma/story/_/id/15503004/ufc-owners-advanced-talks-sell-promotion Immediately after Rovell reported this, UFC President [[Dana White]] went on ''[[The Dan Patrick Show]]'' and denied that the UFC was up for sale, claiming that Zuffa was more focused on "working on deals and our expansion globally" than selling the promotion. However, White would further add that Zuffa would be listening to offers if they met the reported $4 billion.http://www.mmafighting.com/2016/5/11/11657066/dana-white-denies-ufc-for-sale-says-were-working-on-growing-the Despite White's denial of a potential sale, Dave Meltzer of [[SB Nation|SB Nation's]] mmafighting.com reported a month later that the sale of the UFC was imminent, as Zuffa received two bids within the range of $3.9 billion to $4.2 billion from both [[WME-IMG]] and [[China Media Capital]].http://www.mmafighting.com/2016/6/16/11957074/ufc-sale-reportedly-imminent-with-two-bids-in-4-1-billion-range Finally, on July 11, after months of speculation, the UFC released a statement confirming that Zuffa had sold its majority stake to an ownership group headed by [[WME-IMG]] for $4.2 billion.http://www.ufc.com/news/WME-IMG-TO-ACQUIRE-UFC ESPN's Darren Rovell and Brett Okamoto would go on further to report that, despite the sale to WME-IMG, Dana White would be staying on with the UFC as President and would "be given a stake in the new business." They would also add that the Abu Dhabi-based Flash Entertainment would still maintain its 10 percent stake in the company. ==Potential Expansion Into Boxing== Following the sale of their majority stake in the UFC to [[William Morris Endeavor|WME-IMG]], in addition to the success of [[Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Conor McGregor|Floyd Mayweather Jr.'s bout against Conor McGregor]] in 2016 and 2017. UFC President Dana White has teased the idea of Zuffa potentially becoming involved in the sport of [[boxing]]. It's still unclear what the future of this business endeavor is exactly. Though rumors have speculated that Dana White, [[Ari Emanuel]], and others from the UFC have tried to form business partnerships with boxers such as [[Mikey Garcia]]https://www.mmamania.com/2018/5/5/17321052/report-zuffa-boxing-close-to-signing-undefeated-wbc-lightweight-champion-mikey-garcia-ufc and [[Anthony Joshua]]https://www.forbes.com/sites/andrewbrennan/2018/03/30/zuffa-boxings-attempts-to-lure-joshua-threatens-al-haymons-supremacy/#73ef85a94260https://www.sportsnet.ca/mma/ufc-willing-offer-boxing-champ-anthony-joshua-500-million-deal/https://www.mmaweekly.com/dana-white-interested-in-mikey-garcia-for-zuffa-boxing-addresses-anthony-joshua-rumors. In addition to formulating plans around the long running rumors of [[Anderson Silva]] who has long expressed an interest in fighting [[Roy Jones Jr.]]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7NviFGnQRzohttps://www.bloodyelbow.com/2018/1/24/16927184/ufc-mma-boxing-news-interview-roy-jones-jr-anderson-silva-dana-white-boxing. Though this fight in particular is questionable given that both athletes are in the later stages of there careers. Though the UFC did help air Roy Jones Jr.'s "retirement" bout on their [[UFC Fight Pass]] streaming service in early 2018. Another sign that Zuffa has interested in expanding into the sport of boxing to some degree. It has also been thought that UFC is interested in co-promoting boxing matches into their events.http://www.boxingnewsonline.net/ufc-president-dana-white-on-his-move-into-boxing/ Additionally in mid-2018 Dana White, still claiming efforts are being made to expand promotional efforts into boxing. Has stated that he and others aren't interesting in working with any of major boxing sanctioning bodies causing even more speculation. http://www.fightsports.tv/white-claims-zuffa-boxing-wont-work-with-sanctioning-bodies/ This is all in contrast to Dana White's long time disgust with the business of boxing and many of the major promotional figures. Making some to question if this is related to underwhelming business expectations for the UFC.https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-02-14/instead-of-killing-boxing-the-ufc-plans-to-use-it-as-a-lifeline Other rumors that have floated around since the change of ownership of the UFC, consist of [[Bob Arum]] claiming members of the UFC expressing an interest in purchasing either [[Top Rank|Top Rank Promotions]] or at least its video library for $100 million.https://www.boxinginsider.com/columns/will-dana-white-ufc-next-big-players-zuffa-boxing/ ==References== {{Portal|Las Vegas|Companies|MMA}} {{Reflist|30em}} [[Category:Companies established in 2001]] [[Category:Mixed martial arts organizations]] [[Category:Ultimate Fighting Championship]] [[Category:Privately held companies based in the Las Vegas Valley]] [[Category:Companies based in Las Vegas]] [[Category:Sports event promotion companies]]
